post_title: Hey guys! I was wondering if someone can recommend me a Good Laptop so that i can run Cs2 with avg. more than 240fps.
post_body: I have a 240hz benq monitor which i had invested back when Csgo had good fps on my current laptop but since cs2 it's almost impossible to play as my 1% lows dips to 90 and avg stays at 270ish. I can't invest in pc setup because it's kind of a budget crunch and I'm also on the move so a laptop and monitor is way too less hassle.

post_title: How can the scout hit though all that?
Question about Premier
post_body:
So I'm an older CS2 player, I used to play GO back in 2015 till 2017, just getting back into the competitive scene and I heard Premier is the way to go.

For reference I used to be DMG in the original competitive system, and now I'm roughly 5k-6k in Premier. My question is why the fuck are there players that are matched with me, ranging all the way from 4k all the way to 12k players. Sometimes it feels like they don't belong where I am. What's up with that? Thanks in advance - sorry, just used to the old ELO system is all.

post_title: Get older demo files from CS2
post_body:
Is there any way to access older demo games? Not meaning CSGO demos, but previous demos from the last I can see on the list.

post_title: Alternatives to refrag?
post_body: Are there any good alternatives to refrag? Doesn't have to be as complex but it would be nice. In go we could host a server and plugins but I think they didn't support cs2.

post_title: Is 1280 eDPI good?
post_body: I found myself playing on eDPI 2400, which is crazy cuz I started noticing that I have problems with micro-adjustment and decided to greatly lower it. Fellas here talking about having 600-800 eDPI, which is hella slow, It felt like trying to move a 70kg kettlebell

is there any lunch option to remove FSR from graphics settings like -noreflex ?
post_body: I want it removed cause I always switch to low to high  settings. Low settings for playing and high settings for recording, So when I choose the low settings the game always turn the FSR on. If I could permanently remove it from the settings like reflex it wouldve been really helpful.

post_title: clusterfuck on Ancient [GamerLegion vs Passion UA]
HELP - What desk is used on those LANs ?
post_body:
Hi, first of all : i know any desk is good enough to play and im not looking to copycat a prosetup to feel like im a pro myself, i suck at CS.

BUT, that being said, i tried to buy a new desk during Black friday that is ADJUSTABLE IN HEIGHT, got a Skillcorp d15m : Advice, DO NOT buy this crap, never seen such a wiggly thing, already re-packed for refund.

  
So i still want an adjustable desk, but i cant find a test on youtube that takes wiggling as a main comparison point, so i was thinking on buying what pro player use, cuz its gotta good desk, no ?

  
Any help would be appreciated cuz i cannot find the brand that is used

post_title: Are my nerves holding me back in game?
post_body: I have 3k hours and have spent a lot of that time in crosshair placement maps, dm, and obviously in games. i think my crosshair placement and aim is not bad in the aim maps and dms. like I've probably spent 300+ hours in crosshair placement servers/maps. but in game I feel like it goes completely out the window. I get really shaky in game, flick past people I would have an easy time hitting the same shot in dm, my crosshair placement is bad in spots I practice a lot (especially in fast pace moments) My arm tenses very hard in games even when I know im alone in a 1v1 situation or something. I whiff on people not looking at me, and shoot really quick without even trying to aim when someone isn't looking at me. I have smooth easy aim in dm im not flicking on people that are 1 inch away from my crosshair and can cleanly get kills on people not looking at me. im faceit level 10 and I think I occasionally have moments where I clear angles how I want and how I practice but its just not consistent at all. (I play on 1.42 in game, 400 dpi. so my sens should definitely not be the problem for being shaky and missing so many easy shots in game)

mouse cursor moving to other monitors while playing cs.
post_body:
ive played cs2 since it came out and this problem has never occurred for me before. I've changed no display settings either. but whenever I'm playing unpaused, like actually looking around shooting etc., if I flick to the left or right too far, my mouse cursor shows up on my other monitors and if I click to shoot it tabs me out. i don't know what has changed. i tried fullscreen, windowed fullscreen, windowed... they all do the same thing. i normally play on fullscreen. 

  
This is a post I made a while ago, and people in the comments told me to use dual monitor tools which I did. It has worked fine but recently when I have the sticky keybind in the software it makes my sensitivity in game slower randomly. it'll be the right sens and then it will make my sens like 5 times lower for no reason. (also DMT is just annoying to have to do every time to just play the game.) I also tried to set the two other monitors to the corners inside the settings which is okay for about a round but the mouse slowly (invisibly) creeps its way up to the corners and it tabs me out. Before like last month I NEVER had this problem ever. and it fixed itself yesterday where I didn't need to do any stupid method to fix it. But today the problem is back and its very annoying

How difficult is it to convert CS2 maps into blender as a beginner?
post_body:
I wanted to take some CS2 maps and port them into black ops 1. Been really enjoying Bo1 a lot lately again after not playing it for over 12 years and haven't been playing CS as much anymore. Thought it would be fun to see a ton of classic maps like dust 2 over in bo1. 

Has anyone ported any maps into blender before? Is it difficult for a beginner to do? Or do I need more experience?
